content:
Made a small edit in the statement to make it make more sense:
"The word <<palindrome>> is the same word if you read it from right to left or from left to right."
to:
"A word is a <<palindrome>> if it is the same word when you read it from right to left or from left to right."

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Clean and simple, solvable under 5 minutes, thanks for the contribution

Goal section
* Suggest to state "Please ignore case of letters" instead of "Please consider capital letters".
* Please write "e.g." instead of "ex".
* Please explain when "invalid" should be output.

Constraints section
* Please remove the constraint "word is a list of chars".

Thanks.

Constraints section
* Please delete "Line 1:".

Output requirement
* As mentioned in my last comment, please change the output requirement so that the clash does not suffer from the issue of binary output.

Thanks.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Easy and clear!

Goal section
* The specification that the test should be case-insensitive should be added.

Input section and Output section
* Please format the line numbers as <<bold>>.

Output requirement
* Binary output should be avoided as per contribution guidelines. That means, there should be more than 2 possible answers in total for all cases. (Currently, there are only 2 possible answers: true and false.)
Please change the output requirement.

Reference: Clash of Code point 4
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/contribution-guidelines

Thanks.

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: 
Excellent concept, simple et rapide.
Cependant l'énoncé ne précise pas, compte tenu des tests de validation, que l'algorithme doit être insensible à la casse des lettres.
Si c'est pour un Clash vitesse de code cela fait perdre du temps.
Si c'est en taille du code ce n'est pas gênant vu le temps imparti, perdre du temps à réaliser cette spécificité via les cas de test n'a pas un énorme impact sur le résultat dans ce contexte.
Please don't approve a clash with binary output as it clearly doesn't follow the contribution guidelines. Please consider withdrawing your approval for now. Thanks.
You cannot solve the issue of binary output just by changing "true" and "false" to another pair of words. What is really needed is to have more than 2 possible answers in total for all cases.
